publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-990 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Highland Council Housing Stock Transfer-That the Parliament commends Highland Council for the recent public consultation exercise carried out to examine the options available for the future management and ownership of the council's housing stock; recognises the overwhelming satisfaction of Highland Council tenants with their council landlord and the desire of these tenants for ownership and management of their homes to remain with the council; notes the injustice felt by Highland Council that solutions to the indebtedness of councils are only available if stock transfer takes place, and calls upon the Scottish Executive and Her Majesty's Government to address the council's housing debt to enable it to continue to provide a quality housing service. Supported by: Fergus Ewing*

S1M-990 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Highland Council Housing Stock Transfer-That the Parliament commends Highland Council for the recent public consultation exercise carried out to examine the options available for the future management and ownership of the council's housing stock; recognises the overwhelming satisfaction of Highland Council tenants with their council landlord and the desire of these tenants for ownership and management of their homes to remain with the council; notes the injustice felt by Highland Council that solutions to the indebtedness of councils are only available if stock transfer takes place, and calls upon the Scottish Executive and Her Majesty's Government to address the council's housing debt to enable it to continue to provide a quality housing service. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Tommy Sheridan*, Robin Harper*
S1M-990 Highland Council Housing Stock Transfer (lodged on 8 June 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Michael Russell*

S1M-990 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Highland Council Housing Stock Transfer—That the Parliament commends Highland Council for the recent public consultation exercise carried out to examine the options available for the future management and ownership of the council’s housing stock; recognises the overwhelming satisfaction of Highland Council tenants with their council landlord and the desire of these tenants for ownership and management of their homes to remain with the council; notes the injustice felt by Highland Council that solutions to the indebtedness of councils are only available if stock transfer takes place, and calls upon the Scottish Executive and Her Majesty’s Government to address the council’s housing debt to enable it to continue to provide a quality housing service. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Tommy Sheridan, Robin Harper, Donald Gorrie, Michael Russell
